de.schlegel11.eventdispatcher

Class EventDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.schlegel11.eventdispatcher.EventDispatcher

  • public final class EventDispatcher
extends Object
    Class that provides an easy to use event dispatcher.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Marcel Schlegel (schlegel11) on 20.10.14

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static EventDispatcher newInstance()
        Factory method that creates a new EventDispatcher instance.
        Returns:
        A new EventDispatcher instance.

      • addListener

        public boolean addListener(Class<? extends EventListener> clazz,
                           EventListener listener)
        Adds a new EventListener class instance.

        The EventListener class instance is assigned to a specific EventListener class type.
        A specific EventListener class type assigns many EventListener class instances.

        Parameters:
        clazz - Represents a specific unique EventListener class type. If param is null a NullPointerException is thrown.
        listener - Represents a specific EventListener instance. If param is null a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Returns:
        True if the current EventDispatcher did not already contain the specific listener instance.

      • addListener

        public boolean addListener(Class<? extends EventListener> clazz,
                           EventListener listener,
                           int maxCalls)
        Adds a new EventListener class instance with a maximum number of EventListener calls.
        In case of infinite calls please use addListener(Class, java.util.EventListener)

        The EventListener class instance is assigned to a specific EventListener class type.
        A specific EventListener class type assigns many EventListener class instances.

        Parameters:
        clazz - Represents a specific unique EventListener class type. If param is null a NullPointerException is thrown.
        listener - Represents a specific EventListener instance. If param is null a NullPointerException is thrown.
        maxCalls - Represents a maximum number of calls for the specific EventListener instance. The value -1 represents infinite calls. If param is less or equal 0 (except -1) an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Returns:
        True if the current EventDispatcher did not already contain the specific listener instance.

      • removeListener

        public boolean removeListener(Class<? extends EventListener> clazz,
                              EventListener listener)
        Removes a EventListener class instance from a specific EventListener class type.
        If the EventListener class type has no more EventListener class instances it will also be removed.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Represents a specific EventListener class type.
        listener - Represents a specific EventListener instance.
        Returns:
        True if the current EventDispatcher contains the specific clazz type and listener instance.

      • removeListenerType

        public boolean removeListenerType(Class<? extends EventListener> clazz)
        Removes a specific EventListener class type and all associated EventListener instances.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Represents a specific EventListener class type.
        Returns:
        True if the current EventDispatcher contains the specific clazz type and removed it.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all EventListener class type and listener instances. The current EventDispatcher will be empty after this call returns.

      • getListenerCount

        public int getListenerCount()
        Returns the number of all EventListener class instances.
        Returns:
        Number of all EventListener class instances.

      • getListenerCount

        public int getListenerCount(Class<? extends EventListener> clazz)
        Returns the number of all EventListener class instances associated with a specific EventListener class type.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Represents a specific EventListener class type.
        Returns:
        Number of all EventListener class instances associated with a specific EventListener class type.
        If specific clazz type did not exist returns 0.

      • getListenerTypeCount

        public int getListenerTypeCount()
        Returns the number of all EventListener class types.
        Returns:
        Number of all EventListener class types.

      • getListenerMaxCalls

        public int getListenerMaxCalls(Class<? extends EventListener> clazz,
                               EventListener listener)
        Returns the number of maximum calls for the specific EventListener class instance.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Represents a specific EventListener class type.
        listener - Represents a specific EventListener instance.
        Returns:
        The number of maximum calls for the specific EventListener class instance.
        If specific EventListener instance did not exist returns 0.

      • getListenerCurrentCalls

        public int getListenerCurrentCalls(Class<? extends EventListener> clazz,
                                   EventListener listener)
        Returns the number of current calls for the specific EventListener class instance.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Represents a specific EventListener class type.
        listener - Represents a specific EventListener instance.
        Returns:
        The number of current calls for the specific EventListener class instance.
        If specific EventListener instance did not exist returns 0.

      • fireEvent

        public <T extends EventListener> boolean fireEvent(Class<T> clazz,
                                                   Consumer<T> consumer)
        Handel the Consumer lambda expression for all EventListener class instances of a specific EventListener class type.
        If the "maxCalls" (addListener(Class, java.util.EventListener, int)) value of the EventListener class instance is reached the instance will be removed.
        The Consumer input argument is automatically mapped to the clazz type parameter.

        Event methods can be handled like this: 

         fireEvent(SpecificEventListener.class, l  -> l.specificEventListenerMethod(...));
 
        
 or for multiple method calls
 
        
 fireEvent(SpecificEventListener.class, l  -> {
 l.specificEventListenerMethod(...);
 l.anotherSpecificEventListenerMethod(...);
 });
        Type Parameters:
        T - A specific EventListener type that extends from EventListener interface.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Represents a specific EventListener class type. Return False if param is null or current EventDispatcher did not contain type.
        consumer - Represents an operation normally for specific EventListener instances. Return False if param is null.
        Returns:
        True if Consumer operation is successfully handled.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
